make_dir: make new dir. make_dir | test create new test dir
make_many_dir: make many dirs. make_many_dir | test | test1 create test and in test dir create test1 dir
remove_dir: remove dir. remove_dir | test remove test dir. remove_dir | test | all remove not empty dir
where_file: return file path where_file | test.txt return file path
ls: print all files and dirs in current dir
rename_file: rename file name first argument current file name second argument new file name
about_file: see more info about file for example size
cp: copy file first argument filename second argument destination path
mv: move file first argument filename second argument destination path
create_file: create new file required argument filename and file type for example create_file | test.txt
remove_file: remove file required argument filename and file type for example remove_file | test.txt
read_file: read file required argument filename and file type for example read_file | test.txt
write_file: write file first argument filename second argument a for append in file w for write in file last argument text
upload_git: upload project in github first argument repo link, socond argument repo comment, last argument files in order to upload all file write . command
re_upload_git: reupload project in github if .git file is in current dir first argument comment second argument files in order to upload all file write . command
